title: Beefed-Up Shakshuka
steps: Peel and slice onions into half or quarter rings. Core peppers and cut into slices.
Heat olive oil in large shallow pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add peppers and cook another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, parsley, half of the cilantro (8g), and thyme. Stir and cook a couple minutes until starting to brown.
Add ground beef and brown, breaking into pieces.
Add tomatoes and cook 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Season with salt and pepper.
Push four indentations in sauce with back of spoon. Crack one egg into each indentation.
Sprinkle feta chunks over top. Cover and cook eggs 5 minutes, basting whites with sauce halfway through. Whites should be just cooked, yolks still soft.
Sprinkle remaining cilantro over top and serve with bread.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 large onion ≈ 200g, 2 red peppers ≈ 300g, 3 tbsp olive oil ≈ 42g, 2 cloves garlic ≈ 10g, 2 tbsp parsley ≈ 8g, 4 tbsp cilantro ≈ 16g, 1 tsp thyme ≈ 3g
Can be made ahead up to step 5 and chilled or frozen
